meta.name: DESCRIPTION
meta.content: Suffolk County, New York has a vibrant history, illustrated in our important Native American and Revolutionary-era historical sites as well as the lab where DNA was discovered.

meta.name: KEYWORDS
meta.content: H. Lee Dennison Building, Hauppauge, New York, Suffolk County, Government, Services, Online,DotNetNuke,DNN

div.class: d-inline-block col-md border-left border-right border-dark align-top text-center

div.small: Suffolk County's Elected Officials: The County Executive, Comptroller, Clerk, District Attorney The Legislature, and Sheriff
From Aging and Consumer Affairs to Social Services and Youth Bureau, Suffolk County's Departments, Agencies and Bureaus
Register your house with Smart911, make a camping reservation, find your legislator, find where you vote, pay your sewer bill and more...
Apply for permits, register as a Minority-Owned Business, search for properties, liens, and other records, and more...
Apply for Civil Service exams, pay probation fees, pay red light tickets, search for deeds, mortgages, judgments, make a golfing reservation, and more...
Resources for local businesses to access a variety of resources that can provide assistance in obtaining governmental and other contracts.
Numerous resources for starting, financing, or relocating a business in Suffolk County, including licensing, taxes, zoning, compliance, and more.
Access to Business Development Centers, Business Groups, Financial Assistance Centers, IDA's and more.
Suffolk County is a located in the U.S. state of New York. The County occupies the easternmost portion of Long Island, in the southeastern portion of New York State.
From the white sand on the south shore to the bluffs to our north there's always something to do in our parks. Beaches, boat launches, hiking trails, campsites, and golf courses all await you!
The Office of Film and Cultural Affairs exists to promote and expand the richness of experiences that Suffolk has to offer to residents and visitors alike.
There’s no better way to enjoy the true outdoors than enjoying Suffolk County Parks. Discover Suffolk County’s one of a kind parks, beaches, and recreation areas.

span.span: Departments > Health Services > Health Bulletins > Novel Coronavirus

section.class: bg-light p-2 mb-2 border border-default rounded

section.section:
Harvard Health Publishing has created and translated accessible COVID-19 information into 37 different languages to help all patients, especially immigrants and non-English speaking communities, stay informed and healthy. These materials are freely available to the general public without any copyright restrictions.
The website can be found here: www.covid19healthliteracyproject.com
English fact sheets can be found here: covid19healthliteracyproject.com
